abstract: Financial advisers warn that new exchange-traded funds and mutual funds may lower portfolio volatility, but their lack of history suggests investors should be cautious.
snippet: New exchange-traded funds and mutual funds may lower portfolio volatility, but their lack of history suggests investors should be cautious, advisers say.
lead_paragraph: New exchange-traded funds and mutual funds may lower portfolio volatility, but their lack of history suggests investors should be cautious, advisers say.

headline.main: Exotic Investments That Offer Gains, but Also Pose Risks
headline.print_headline: Exotic Investments That Offer Gains, but Also Pose Risks
headline.seo: Niche E.T.F.’s Offer Portfolio Alternative, but Caution Is Advised
